section.title: What is Synopsis?
section.para: Synopsis is not a random name. Consider this definition:

blockquote.attribution: Webster's Revised Unabridged Dictionary, © 1996, 1998 MICRA, Inc.
blockquote.para: \Syn*op"sis\, n.; pl. Synopses. [L., from Gr. ?; sy`n with, together + ? a sight, view, from the root seen in E. optic.] A general view, or a collection of heads or parts so arranged as to exhibit a general view of the whole; an abstract or summary of a discourse; a syllabus; a conspectus.
That the reader may see in one view the exactness of the method, as well as force of the argument, I shall here draw up a short synopsis of this epistle. --Bp. Warburton.
Syn: Abridgment; compendium; epitome; abstract; summary; syllabus; conspectus. See Abridgment.

section.para: Synopsis is a tool for generating documentation of a program's structure, using mainly comments embedded in the source code. The end result is ideally documentation that provides an accessible view of the interface, structure and workings of a program or library, depending on the intent of the person creating the documentation.

Synopsis has a very modular design, allowing multiple source languages and output formats. Between the input and output, complex transformations can be made to simplify the structure or rename types, as suits the documentation.

section.title: This Document
section.para: This document is intended to be a complete user manual for the Synopsis application. It provides both introductory materials on how to use the application to generate documentation, and advanced materials on how to extend Synopsis with custom modules to perform extra tasks.
